intro: Dichrostachys cinerea var. plurijuga, commonly known as the African burr legume, is a shrub native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces distinctive, hooked pods that contain seeds with a tuft of silky hair, aiding in wind dispersal. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
